Ecclesiasticus *__25.1: With three things my spirit is pleased, which are approved before God and men:
Ecclesiasticus *__25.2: The concord of brethren, and the love of neighbours, and man and wife that agree well together.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.3: Three sorts my soul hateth, and I am greatly grieved at their life:
Ecclesiasticus *__25.4: A poor man that is proud: a rich man that is a liar: an old man that is a fool, and doting.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.5: The things that thou hast not gathered in thy youth, how shalt thou find them in thy old age?
Ecclesiasticus *__25.6: O how comely is judgment for a grey head, and for ancients to know counsel!
Ecclesiasticus *__25.7: O how comely is wisdom for the aged, and understanding and counsel to men of honour!
Ecclesiasticus *__25.8: Much experience is the crown of old men, and the fear of God is their glory.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.9: Nine things that are not to be imagined by the heart have I magnified, and the tenth I will utter to men with my tongue.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.10: A man that hath joy of his children: and he that liveth and seeth the fall of his enemies.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.11: Blessed is he. that dwelleth with a wise woman, and that hath not slipped with his tongue, and that hath not served such as are unworthy of him.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.12: Blessed is he that findeth a true friend, and that declareth justice to an ear that heareth.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.13: How great is he that findeth wisdom and knowledge! but there is none above him that feareth the Lord.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.14: The fear of God hath set itself above all things:
Ecclesiasticus *__25.15: Blessed is the man, to whom it is given to have the fear of God: he that holdeth it, to whom shall he be likened?
Ecclesiasticus *__25.16: The fear of God is the beginning of his love: and the beginning of faith is to be fast joined unto it.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.17: The sadness of the heart is every plague: and the wickedness of a woman is all evil.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.18: And a man will choose any plague, but the plague of the heart:
Ecclesiasticus *__25.19: And any wickedness, but the wickedness of a woman:
Ecclesiasticus *__25.20: And any affliction, but the affliction from them that hate him:
Ecclesiasticus *__25.21: And any revenge, but the revenge of enemies.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.22: There is no head worse than the head of a serpent:
Ecclesiasticus *__25.23: And there is no anger above the anger of a woman. It will be more agreeable to abide with a lion and a dragon, than to dwell with a wicked woman.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.24: The wickedness of a woman changeth her face: and she darkeneth her countenance as a bear: and sheweth it like sackcloth. In the midst of her neighbours,
Ecclesiasticus *__25.25: Her husband groaned, and hearing he sighed a little.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.26: All malice is short to the malice of a woman, let the lot of sinners fall upon her.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.27: As the climbing of a sandy way is to the feet of the aged, so is a wife full of tongue to a quiet man.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.28: Look not upon a woman's beauty, and desire not a woman for beauty.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.29: A woman's anger, and impudence, and confusion is great.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.30: A woman, if she have superiority, is contrary to her husband.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.31: A wicked woman abateth the courage, and maketh a heavy countenance, and a wounded heart.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.32: Feeble hands, and disjointed knees, a woman that doth not make her husband happy.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.33: From the woman came the beginning of sin, and by her we all die.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.34: Give no issue to thy water, no, not a little: nor to a wicked woman liberty to gad abroad.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.35: If she walk not at thy hand, she will confound thee in the sight of thy enemies.
Ecclesiasticus *__25.36: Cut her off from thy flesh, lest she always abuse thee.
